title: Charter Hall industrial fund completes $725m capital raise
text:
Charter Hall's wholesale industrial fund has closed a $725 million equity fundraising that tapped the appetite of local and overseas investors for putting capital into the fast-growing logistics sector.

The unlisted Charter Hall Prime Industrial Fund pulled in new and existing investors to the oversubscribed capital-raising, which boosted the firepower of the $3.9 billion industrial and logistics portfolio.

Investors are racing to put money into logistics and industrial property.

Charter Hall managing director and chief executive David Harrison said: "Global investment conditions remain very favourable for the Australian commercial property market, which is competitive for high-quality, long-leased investment assets.

"The raising demonstrates Charter Hall’s ability to source capital from the unlisted market and marry that equity with high-quality investment opportunities in the industrial logistics sector."

The developer and fund manager last year booked a bumper 25.5 per cent lift in operating earnings, boosted by investors looking for better returns in a global environment of low interest rates. The latest raising, which Charter Hall called "significantly oversubscribed", showed that demand continued.
description: Demand is rising for logistics premises, particularly in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.
